original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid-day trade on Wednesday as investors are waiting for clear directions on the economic front, an analyst said.
All Share Index was down 0.46 percent or 42.70 points to 9,302.83, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.55 percent or 15.06 points to 2,713.89.
“Investors are taking a wait and see approach as they are searching for directions and policy directions following the IMF approval for the extended loan” an analyst said.
Top losers during mid-day trade were Expo Lanka, Hatton National Bank and Sampath Bank. (Colombo/April19/2023)
